intro: Pentaphragma honbaense, commonly known as the Honba Mountain bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue to violet in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
